title: Analysts say experience, not funding, is hindering European smallsat launchers
summary:

title: SES leans on SKY Perfect JSAT as inflight demand outpaces expanded fleet
summary:
SES has turned to Japan’s flagship operator for extra satellite bandwidth to keep up with soaring connectivity demand from passengers flying across Asia, even after significantly expanding its own fleet by buying Intelsat.

title: ESA and AfSA join forces for systems engineering training
summary: From 7 to 10 October 2025, Europe and Africa took another important step toward deepening their cooperation in space. At the ESA Education Training and Learning Facility in ESEC-Galaxia, Belgium, young engineers from across both continents came together for the Space Systems Engineering Training Course, jointly supported by the European Space Agency (ESA) and the African Space Agency (AfSA).

title: Why the U.S. shouldn’t simply race to Lagrange points
summary:

title: Intuitive Machines to acquire Lanteris Space Systems
summary:
Intuitive Machines, a lunar lander company, announced Nov. 4 it is buying Lanteris Space Systems, a satellite builder formerly known as Maxar.

title: China conducts ground tests on inflatable, reconfigurable space manufacturing module
summary:
A Chinese institute recently completed ground tests on what it describes as a reconfigurable flexible on-orbit manufacturing platform, targeting future large-scale, low-cost space manufacturing.
